subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
author: Zack Widup
full_text:
Heehee - there was a mockingbird nest somewhere in the vicinity.
Mockingbirds, when nesting, sing 24 hours a day. This one was going all
night in true mockingbird fashion.

There wouldn't have been any heating or cooling fans, night watchmen, sump
or plumbing system sounds as there were none where I was the other night.
Everything else plus the coyotes and car traffic came through on pocket
audio recorders. Plus the speedway a couple miles down the road between
about 7:30 and 10:30 pm. THAT was the worst! VRROOOM!  VRROOOM!

Zack

On Mon, Jun 8, 2009 at 1:39 PM, Rj <rasterer@...> wrote:

>
>
>   You potentially could have heard lots of things.
>
> Some that come to mind are cats, mice, structural shifts, weather, birds
> outside, heating or cooling fans, curious insects, a night watchman, sump or
> plumbing systems ... the possibilities are endless.
>
> --- On *Mon, 6/8/09, Zack Widup <w9sz.zack@...>* wrote:
>
>
> From: Zack Widup <w9sz.zack@...>
> Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
> To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
> Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 10:40 AM
>
>   I am curious if anyone with a microphone wired to a remote site has ever
> gotten any EVP in real time.
>
> I took part in an investigation of Ashmore Estates, near Ashmore IL, on
> Saturday night. We had six video cameras set up in the three halls of the
> building. The video for all was being monitored and recorded at a central
> location. Alas, we did not have microphones at the camera sites conected to
> the central location. I wonder what we might have heard if we did?
>
> Zack
>
>
> On Mon, Jun 8, 2009 at 12:05 PM, threadsintyme@ juno.com<http://mc/compose?to=threadsintyme@...>
> <Threadsintyme@ juno.com <http://mc/compose?to=Threadsintyme@...>>wrote:
>
> Let's just agree to end this discussion about her...
> Why don't we discuss something on a lighter note? Anyone have any new ideas
> about either evp or ITC?
> Al
>
>
> 
>
